author: Amelia Walsh
title: Blue Origin Announces All-Women Crew For Upcoming Mission
text:
Blue Origin Announces All-Women Crew For Upcoming Mission
An all-woman crew including Jeff Bezos‚Äô fiance and singer Katy Perry are headed to space, Blue Origin announced Thursday.
An all-women crew will take flight for Blue Origin‚Äôs 31st mission, the company announced Thursday.
Lauren S√°nchez, a pilot, journalist and fianc√© to the company‚Äôs founder Jeff Bezos, will head the mission. Sanchez will be joined by journalist Gayle King, singer Katy Perry, bioastronautics scientist Amanda Nguyen, former NASA rocket scientist Aisha Bowe, and film producer Kerianne Flynn to complete the six-person crew.
According to Blue Origin, the mission marks the 11th human flight for New Shepherd sending passengers past the K√°rm√°n line‚Äîan area 62 miles above Earth‚Äôs surface that is widely recognized as the altitude at which outer space begins. The mission marks the first all-female crew since Valentina Tereshkova‚Äôs solo flight in 1963.
No pilots will be on board for the 11-minute journey as the New Shepherd vehicle is fully autonomous. The flight is set to launch this Spring though no official date has been set.
‚ÄúI am looking forward to all the women in this crew sharing their story and inspiring future generations to dream big,‚Äù S√°nchez said.
Amelia WalshAuthor

author: Di√°rio Ga√∫cho
title: Rosquinhas s√£o fonte de renda extra para recome√ßo p√≥s-enchente | DG
text: Brique do DG Rosquinhas s√£o fonte de renda extra para recome√ßo p√≥s-enchente Produ√ß√£o dos doces come√ßou durante a pandemia, e agora surge como esperan√ßa de reconstru√ß√£o Na casa de Karina de C√°ssia Oliveira, 45 anos, a fabrica√ß√£o de donuts ‚Äì como s√£o chamadas as rosquinhas doces com cobertura ‚Äì √©, desde os anos de pandemia, um momento de uni√£o entre m√£e e filhas e a oportunidade de a professora de educa√ß√£o especial gerar uma renda extra. Agora, a produ√ß√£o ganha uma import√¢ncia ainda maior: com as vendas, a fam√≠lia espera reconstruir o lar, no bairro Fortuna, em Sapucaia do Sul, que foi atingido pela enchente de maio. Em 2020, com as aulas acontecendo de forma remota devido ao distanciamento social, Karina se viu tendo mais tempo para passar com as tr√™s filhas, hoje, com cinco, 13 e 19 anos. Foi por isso que decidiu desenterrar a antiga receita de rosquinhas da m√£e, que trabalhava como cozinheira de escola. O doce lembrava bons momentos de sua inf√¢ncia e poderia reconfortar a fam√≠lia naquele momento dif√≠cil. ‚Äî Eu nunca fui boa na cozinha, porque minha m√£e fazia tudo, mas era sempre um lugar de reuni√£o. Na pandemia, meu marido n√£o ficava em casa porque √© policial militar, ent√£o estava na linha de frente. Eu e as meninas decidimos ir para a cozinha e aprimoramos a receita das rosquinhas ‚Äî conta Karina. Quando vizinhos e amigos come√ßaram a querer experimentar a guloseima, a professora viu a chance de transform√°-la em uma fonte de renda. Desafio A partir da√≠, a produ√ß√£o se expandiu e as meninas come√ßaram a fazer, tamb√©m, biscoitos amanteigados. Com o dinheiro das vendas, ainda em 2020, a fam√≠lia conseguiu comprar novos m√≥veis para a cozinha. ‚Äî N√≥s fazemos por encomenda, mas, quando saio para entregar, sempre levo uns a mais e n√£o me recordo de voltar para casa com algum. Diminu√≠mos o ritmo por um tempo, por causa de trabalho e estudos, mas as pessoas perguntavam e queriam comprar. Vendemos muito at√© para outras cidades ‚Äî conta Karina. A fam√≠lia n√£o escapou dos desafios do empreendedorismo. Os pre√ßos dos insumos aumentaram ao longo do tempo, mas diminuir a qualidade dos produtos n√£o √© uma op√ß√£o para Karina. Isso fez com que os ganhos diminu√≠ssem. Ainda assim, a professora entende que arrecada um bom valor com as vendas: ‚Äî √â dif√≠cil, porque n√£o queremos mexer na qualidade nem no valor, gostamos de fazer mas tamb√©m tem que ter lucro. Diminu√≠mos o valor da entrega, que a minha filha do meio faz quando √© perto de casa. Na busca por uma nova cozinha Karina, agora, pretende conquistar uma cozinha nova por meio dos donuts mais uma vez. √â que a enchente de maio invadiu a casa da fam√≠lia e muito pouco foi salvo. Foram 13 dias hospedadas na casa de uma amiga e com o marido da professora em Uruguaiana a trabalho, sem conseguir voltar para casa. Entre as perdas, est√£o o microondas e a fritadeira, eletrodom√©sticos que as confeiteiras utilizam na produ√ß√£o. ‚Äî Estamos derretendo chocolate para a cobertura em banho-maria, demora bastante ‚Äî lamenta. Mas o que mais entristece Karina √© o quarto das filhas mais velhas. Leitoras vorazes, as cole√ß√µes de livros que tanto prezam foram perdidas. √â para a reposi√ß√£o dos exemplares que ser√° destinada boa parte da arrecada√ß√£o das vendas. E, assim como na pandemia, os donuts est√£o servindo para reunir e consolar a fam√≠lia desde que voltou para casa. Para encomendar os donuts de Karina, entre em contato pelo (51) 99973-2218 ou acesse o perfil [@gostosurasdakaka2600](https://www.instagram.com/gostosurasdakaka2600/) no Instagram. *Produ√ß√£o: Caroline Fraga

author: Team Latestly
title: Exotic Patagonian Mara Seen Frolicking in Colorado Mountains, Rescue Operation On (See Pic and Video) | üëç LatestLY
text: Wildlife officials are on the lookout after an exotic Patagonian mara, a rabbit-like rodent native to South America, was spotted frolicking in the Colorado mountains. A user posted a video of the rare spotting on X, formerly Twitter. The sighting was first reported on Monday, and officials confirmed on Wednesday that the search for the elusive Patagonian mara is still ongoing. The adorable critter, standing two to three feet tall, has been seen by park rangers, hikers, and visitors in Bear Creek Lake Park, located just 15 miles outside of downtown Denver. Shark Attack in US: Shark Attacks Four People on South Padre Island During July 4 Celebrations, One Hospitalised (Watch Video). Exotic Animal Seen Frolicking in Colorado Mountains What is this thing? Seen near Morrison, Colorado USA pic.twitter.com/RfBvVJAMY6 ‚Äî Visual feast (@visualfeastwang) July 2, 2024 Operation to Rescue Exotic Patagonian Mara On Exotic Patagonian mara ‚Äî a tiny two to three-foot-tall critter ‚Äî seen by park rangers, hikers, visitors in Bear Creek Lake Park in Lakewood, CO, primarily found in grasslands and brushlands in central and southern Argentina - Rangers trying to catch it & find it a home - pic.twitter.com/13GsmHMLJ9 ‚Äî Blanche Victoria (@tammytabby) July 5, 2024

author: /author/int-no_author
title: 'Boiling Point': A new heat series from The Japan Times - The Japan Times
text: Japan is no stranger to hot summers, but because of climate change, temperatures are being pushed into territory that is extreme even by those standards. The notably high heat of early July ‚Äî in what should have been the somewhat cooler tsuyu rainy season ‚Äî is evidence of that, with temperatures hitting [as high as 40 degrees Celsius](https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2024/07/07/japan/japan-extreme-heat/) in the city of Shizuoka. That bodes ill for the rest of the summer, with the Meteorological Agency expecting it to be on par with last year‚Äôs scorcher. Society is having to adapt to this new reality as temperatures trend upward, which they will continue to do ‚Äî at least until the world stops pumping carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases into the atmosphere. And the media needs to change too, shifting the way it approaches and discusses heat in order to better convey the harm and disruption that this weather can cause. To that end, The Japan Times is initiating "Boiling Point," a special series focused on this year‚Äôs scorching summer that will also lay the groundwork for enhanced heat coverage in future years. As a rich, developed country, Japan is much better placed to handle the extra strain posed by extreme heat. But even so, impacts can already be seen across health, culture, sports and other areas. For example, the country‚Äôs growing number of elderly people, one of the most vulnerable groups, [ups the health risks](https://www.japantimes.co.jp/environment/2023/07/30/climate-change/climate-change-heat-waves-aging-society/) posed by heat, raising questions for the medical system. And culturally, haiku poets are finding themselves [unable to use traditional symbolism](https://www.japantimes.co.jp/environment/2023/11/19/climate-change/climate-change-summer-autumn-traditions/), while numerous events [have been rescheduled or are considering doing so](https://www.japantimes.co.jp/culture/2024/06/09/music/summer-concert-festival-japan-music/). But Japan isn‚Äôt sitting still. From special cooling jackets for outdoors workers to the rolling out of ‚Äúcooling shelters,‚Äù various adaptation measures have already taken shape. We will be tracking these solutions, while offering readers practical tips on how to get through the season. Engaging teams across the newsroom, the project will cover topics ranging from work and sports to the aging of society, along the way illustrating not only the challenges the heat poses but also the country‚Äôs solutions and adaptations to them. Fundamentally our reporting on the issue will seek to empower our readers by aiding their understanding of heat‚Äôs causes and consequences and giving them the information they need to properly respond.

author: Marina Ferreira
title: Saiba qual vegetal comer para ajudar a reduzir a gordura no f√≠gado
text:
Saiba qual vegetal comer para ajudar a reduzir a gordura no f√≠gado
A nutricionista Nathali Loyola lista ‚Äúalguns alimentos que s√£o indispens√°veis‚Äù para melhorar o quadro de gordura no f√≠gado
atualizado
Compartilhar not√≠cia
Google News - Metr√≥poles
No ‚Äúquebra-cabe√ßa‚Äù do corpo humano,
o f√≠gado tem a miss√£o de filtrar o sangue e ajudar o organismo a eliminar toxinas e res√≠duos. Considerado multitarefa, o √≥rg√£o vital soma mais de 500 fun√ß√µes, desde produzir a bile at√© armazenar vitaminas. Entretanto, algo pode comprometer esse funcionamento: a gordura.
Em entrevista √†
coluna Claudia Meireles, a nutricionista Nathali Loyola, de S√£o Paulo, explica que a gordura no f√≠gado √© resultado do excesso de carboidratos e calorias consumidas. ‚ÄúIsso desencadeia uma poss√≠vel resist√™ncia √† insulina‚Äù, destaca. A especialista lista ‚Äúalguns alimentos que s√£o indispens√°veis‚Äù para melhorar o quadro. Um desses alimentos √© o alho, conforme explica a nutricionista: ‚ÄúCont√©m alicina, e v√°rios estudos j√° provaram que o alho auxilia na redu√ß√£o dos n√≠veis elevados do colesterol total‚Äù. Nathali acrescenta quanto a esse vegetal ‚Äúaumentar as enzimas antioxidantes, principalmente a glutationa, com potencial de proteger o f√≠gado contra danos oxidativos‚Äù.
Al√©m do alho,
a especialista em nutri√ß√£o aconselha adicionar √†s refei√ß√µes os vegetais verde-escuros. ‚ÄúEsses alimentos s√£o ricos em fibras e trazem compostos bioativos, como polifenois e carotenoides, que atuam como anti-inflamat√≥rios. Tamb√©m ajudam a neutralizar os radicais livres e a reduzir danos √†s c√©lulas hep√°ticas‚Äù, aponta Nathali.
Alerta no Brasil
Segundo dados do
Instituto Brasileiro do F√≠gado (Ibrafig), de 2021, em torno de 30% da popula√ß√£o do Brasil est√° com gordura no f√≠gado. Cansa√ßo, fraqueza, barriga inchada, dor no abd√¥men e perda de apetite s√£o alguns dos sintomas decorrentes da condi√ß√£o. Em casos mais graves, o paciente pode apresentar icter√≠cia e hemorragias.
Para saber mais, siga o
 perfil de Vida&Estilo no Instagram.

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Afghanistan Cricket Star Shapoor Zadran Retires at 37
text:
Afghanistan Cricket Star Shapoor Zadran Retires at 37
Fast bowler Shapoor Zadran has announced his retirement from international cricket at the age of 37. He made his debut in 2009 and played 44 ODIs and 36 T20Is, collecting a total of 80 wickets. Shapoor rose to fame during the 2015 ODI World Cup, notably contributing to Afghanistan's first victory in a major tournament against Scotland. His career was marked by challenges, but he expressed gratitude for the support from fans, teammates, and family throughout his journey.
By the Numbers- 80 wickets in 80 international matches (44 ODIs, 36 T20Is).
- Played a key role in Afghanistan's historic win against Scotland, taking 4 for 38 and finishing with 12 not out.
While celebrated for his contributions, Shapoor's later career was limited, with his last international appearance in 2020, raising questions about the future of Afghanistan's bowling lineup without his experience.
State of Play- Shapoor's retirement leaves a gap in an evolving Afghan cricket team.
- The team must now seek to develop emerging bowlers to fill his shoes amid ongoing international competitions.
The Afghan cricket team will need to strategize for upcoming matches, focusing on nurturing younger talent while adapting to the absence of Shapoor's experience and leadership.
Bottom LineShapoor Zadran's retirement marks the end of an era for Afghanistan cricket, emphasizing the need for continual player development to uphold the team's competitive edge on the international stage.
Read more at ESPNcricinfo
The summary of the linked article was generated with the assistance of artificial intelligence technology from OpenAI

author: Fatma Khaled
title: Hezbollah Fired Missile at Greek Catholic Church in Israel on Day After Christmas: IDF - The Messenger
text: [Florida Woman Sues Hershey‚Äôs For $5 Billion Over Reese‚Äôs Pumpkins Not Having Jack-o-Lantern Faces](/news/hersheys-class-action-florida-5-billion-reeses-peanut-butter-jack-o-lantern-faces?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=trending_story) Hezbollah Fired Missile at Greek Catholic Church in Israel on Day After Christmas: IDF The apparent missile strike came amid increased fire on the Lebanon-Israel border [Fatma Khaled](/author/fatma-khaled) The Israel Defense Forces said on Tuesday that the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah fired an anti-tank missile from Lebanon, striking St. Mary‚Äôs Greek Church of Iqrit in northern Israel. The [IDF said on X](https://twitter.com/IDF/status/1739630534416838750?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1739630534416838750%7Ctwgr%5E9a969ef7bdcddfa5450d2c16354d0085f36b2fae%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.timesofisrael.com%2Fliveblog_entry%2Fidf-confirms-hezbollah-anti-tank-missile-hit-greek-orthodox-church-in-northern-israel%2F), formerly Twitter, that the missile that struck the church injured one civilian, but didn‚Äôt mention damage to the church or its surrounding structures. A video clip of a missile attack published by Hezbollah was the strike in question, according to Israel. The video appears to show a missile hitting a structure near a church, though it could not be independently confirmed. St. Mary‚Äôs Church of Iqrit is a Greek Catholic church, [according to Greek news agency AMNA](https://www.amna.gr/home/article/785932/I-Chezmpolach-eplixe-ekklisia-sto-boreio-Israil). The IDF erroneously said it was a Greek Orthodox church. Iqrit is a [Christian village](https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/politics/1994/01/20/2-weeks-that-turned-into-45-years/132b3bfa-f8d1-4362-8b29-22b034360b5f/) located 16 miles northeast of Acre, a port city northwest Israel. Israeli officials said that the Dec. 26 strike injured nine soldiers, [the Jerusalem Post reported](https://www.jpost.com/breaking-news/article-779617). In retaliatory response, the IDF struck Hezbollah infrastructure in Lebanon, including a building where one of the group‚Äôs fighters was hiding. Hezbollah didn‚Äôt claim responsibility for the attack on the church as of Friday morning, but the [Greek City Times](https://greekcitytimes.com/2023/12/27/hezbollah-northern-israel-catholic/), [RT Arabic](https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/gaza-war-grinds-tensions-soar-israels-volatile-northern-105973045), and [Beirut 24](https://www.beirut24.org/2023/11/20/%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AD%D8%B2%D8%A8-%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%AA%D9%87%D8%AF%D9%81-%D8%AB%D9%83%D9%86%D8%A9-%D8%A8%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%86%D9%8A%D8%AA-%D8%A8%D8%B5%D8%A7%D8%B1%D9%88%D8%AE%D9%8A-%D8%A8%D8%B1%D9%83%D8%A7/) reported that the group claimed responsibility for attacking military targets Tuesday in northern Israel, which [borders Lebanon](https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/gaza-war-grinds-tensions-soar-israels-volatile-northern-105973045). Alex Gandler, Israeli Deputy spokesperson Ministry of Foreign Affairs, said on Tuesday that the strike violates international law. [Hezbollah Fires on Israelis Rescuing Man Injured in Strike on Church in Northern Israel](/news/hezbollah-greek-orthodox-church-rocket-attack-northern-israel?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Hezbollah Fires Rockets at North Israel After Airstrike Kills 5 of Group‚Äôs Senior Fighters](/news/hezbollah-fires-rockets-at-north-israel-after-airstrike-kills-5-of-groups-senior-fighters?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Israel Sends Warning to Lebanon: Tell Hezbollah to Back Off or Face War](/news/israel-hezbollah-lebanon-warning-north-rocket-attacks?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [IDF Claims New Video Shows Israel Hitting Hezbollah Targets](/news/newly-released-video-idf-israel-hezbollah-targets?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Israel Sections off Territory on Lebanon Border After Exchanging Fire With Hezbollah](/news/israel-gaza-hezbollah-lebanon-border-battleground-hamas?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Catholic Priest Stabbed to Death Inside Nebraska Church](/news/catholic-priest-stabbed-to-death-inside-nebraska-church-stephen-gutgsell?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) ‚ÄúThis attack is not only a clear violation of @UN Security Council Resolution 1701, but also a violation of the freedom of worship,‚Äù [he tweeted](https://twitter.com/AlexGandler/status/1739637713903505554?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1739637713903505554%7Ctwgr%5E5771c16fa85801e263e5800b820cf3b493de1934%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fgreekcitytimes.com%2F2023%2F12%2F27%2Fhezbollah-northern-israel-catholic%2F). Since the Israel-Hamas war broke out in October, the IDF [struck the Saint Porphyrius Church](https://themessenger.com/news/israel-admits-its-airstrike-damaged-historic-gaza-church-where-officials-say-18-were-killed), a Greek-Orthodox church Gaza City, killing 18 people and injuring nearly 100 others. Earlier this month, The Latin Patriarchate of Jerusalem, which oversees Catholic parishes in the Palestinian territories, Israel, Jordan and Cyprus, [said](https://www.lpj.org/en/news/gaza-16th-december-2023) that an IDF sniper [killed two wome](https://themessenger.com/news/palestinian-christians-gaza-fear-extinction-israel-hamas-war)n in a Gaza church. author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text:
NATION 20 fillings, 4 root canals, 8 crowns in one visit add up to lawsuit for Minnesota dentist Mary Walrath-Holdridge USA TODAY A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her.
The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and Molldrem Family Dentistry caused her significant injury that is still being corrected.
According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement.
Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up.
Treatment called 'inconceivable' Gypsy Rose Blanchard released from Missouri prison early Thursday morning, DOC confirms Cher files for conservatorship of her son, claims Elijah Blue Allman's life is 'at risk' Ex-boyfriend of missing St. Louis woman admits to her murder after Wisconsin arrest: Police 6 dead, 3 injured in Johnson County, Texas, crash; victims include 2 young kids ages 9, 10 California Pizza Huts lay off all delivery drivers ahead of minimum wage increase ‚ÄúIt is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,‚Äù wrote Dr. Avrum Goldstein, a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit.
Goldstein, who is a faculty member at NOVA Southeastern University , also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment.
"[Wilson‚Äôs] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,‚Äù he said in his report. ‚ÄúTrying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.‚Äù
Doctors remove wrong organ from man: They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says.
The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg.
‚ÄúAny negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote.
Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldrem‚Äôs ‚Äúnegligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages.
Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.
